title: Make placeholder artwork images match each marble art name (unique per item)

requirements.text: Update the placeholder marble art catalog so each item card uses an image that visually matches its item title/category, instead of reusing the same image across many items.

quotes: bro make the arts as u defined the name they were same almost pls correct the pictures

acceptanceCriteria: In each collection section (Krishna, Ganesha, Shiva, Parvati, Handmade Human Portraits, Marble Structures, Other Gods), each of the 4 item cards displays a different image (no single image reused for all items in that section).
Images for Shiva items look distinct from Parvati items, which look distinct from Human Portrait items, which look distinct from Marble Structures items (clear visual differentiation by category).
All item images are served from local static paths under /assets/generated (no external URLs).

requirements.text: Modify frontend/src/data/placeholders.ts so every MarbleItem in each collection array points to its own dedicated local image filename under "/assets/generated" (one unique image per item id).
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/data/placeholders.ts no longer repeats the same image path across multiple different items within the same collection array.
Each itemâ€™s image path matches an existing generated asset filename listed in this build request (and stored under frontend/public/assets/generated).
The UI renders without broken images (no 404s for any placeholder image paths).

constraints: Frontend must not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Do not route images through the backend; images must be static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services or databases).
nonGoals: Do not add new sections, navigation items, or change user-facing copy beyond what is required to fix image-to-item mismatches.
Do not implement backend-driven inventory management or admin upload features.
